greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the largest number such that all of a(n)'s length-n substrings are distinct and divisible by 98.
example: a(4) is 225488 because its length-4 substrings (2254, 2548, 5488) are all distinct and divisible by 98 and there is no larger number with this property.
results.author: _Hans Havermann_, Mar 29 2004
